javadoc:
General purpose class to provide convenience methods for doing "System" type
 stuff, e.g., find resources, date/time, etc. All methods in this class are
 static.

methods.javadoc:
Get the user that is running the ghidra application
@return the user name
methods.name: getUserName
methods.comment: Get the user that is running the ghidra application

methods.name: getBooleanProperty
methods.comment:
Gets the boolean value of the  system property by the given name.  If the property is
 not set, the defaultValue is returned.   If the value is set, then it will be passed
 into Boolean#parseBoolean(String).

return.comment: true if the property is set and has a value of 'true', ignoring case

methods.javadoc:
Returns a non-null value if the system property is set that triggers the
 font override setting, which makes all Java and Ghidra component fonts
 the same size.
@return a non-null value if the system property is set that triggers the
         font override setting, which makes all Java and Ghidra component
         fonts the same size.
@see #FONT_SIZE_OVERRIDE_PROPERTY_NAME
methods.name: getFontSizeOverrideValue
methods.comment:
Returns a non-null value if the system property is set that triggers the
 font override setting, which makes all Java and Ghidra component fonts
 the same size.

return.comment:
a non-null value if the system property is set that triggers the
         font override setting, which makes all Java and Ghidra component
         fonts the same size.

methods.name: adjustForFontSizeOverride
methods.comment:
Checks to see if the font size override setting is enabled and adjusts
 the given font as necessary to match the override setting. If the setting
 is not enabled, then font is returned.

params.name: font
params.comment: The current font to adjust, if necessary.

return.comment: a font object with the proper size.

methods.javadoc:
returns the current date/time using default DATE/TIME format
@return the current date/time using default DATE/TIME format
methods.name: getDateTime
methods.comment: returns the current date/time using default DATE/TIME format

return.comment: the current date/time using default DATE/TIME format

methods.name: getDateTime
methods.comment: returns the current date/time using specified DATE/TIME format

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the system is running during a test.
@return true if the system is running during a test.
methods.name: isInTestingMode
methods.comment: Returns true if the system is running during a test.

return.comment: true if the system is running during a test.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the system is running during a batch, automated test.
@return true if the system is running during a batch, automated test.
methods.name: isInTestingBatchMode
methods.comment: Returns true if the system is running during a batch, automated test.

return.comment: true if the system is running during a batch, automated test.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the system is running without a GUI.
@return true if the system is running without a GUI.
methods.name: isInHeadlessMode
methods.comment: Returns true if the system is running without a GUI.

return.comment: true if the system is running without a GUI.

methods.name: runSwingNow
methods.comment:
Calls the given suppler on the Swing thread, blocking with a
 SwingUtilities#invokeAndWait(Runnable).  Use this method when you need to get
 a value while being on the Swing thread.

 
 		String value = runSwingNow(() - label.getText());

params.name: s
params.comment: the supplier that will be called on the Swing thread

methods.name: runSwingNow
methods.comment: Calls the given runnable on the Swing thread.

methods.name: runSwingLater
methods.comment:
Calls the given runnable on the Swing thread in the future by putting the request on
 the back of the event queue.

methods.name: isInDevelopmentMode
methods.comment:
Returns true if we are running in development mode. The assumption is
 that if this class is in a jar file, then we are in production mode.

return.comment: true if we are running in development mode

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the application is a release and not in development or testing
@return true if the application is a release and not in development or testing
methods.name: isInReleaseMode
methods.comment: Returns true if the application is a release and not in development or testing

return.comment: true if the application is a release and not in development or testing

methods.name: isEqual
methods.comment:
Returns whether or not the two indicated objects are equal. It allows
 either or both of the specified objects to be null.

return.comment: true if the objects are equal.

methods.javadoc:
A development/testing time method to make sure the current thread is the swing thread.
@param errorMessage The message to display when the assert fails
methods.name: assertThisIsTheSwingThread
methods.comment: A development/testing time method to make sure the current thread is the swing thread.

params.name: errorMessage
params.comment: The message to display when the assert fails

methods.name: getSourceLocationForClass
methods.comment:
Returns a file that contains the given class. If the class is in a jar file, then 
 the jar file will be returned. If the file is in a .class file, then the directory 
 containing the package root will be returned (i.e. the "bin" directory).

params.name: classObject
params.comment: the class for which to get the location

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this is the event dispatch thread. Note that this method returns true in
 headless mode because any thread in headless mode can dispatch its own events. In swing
 environments, the swing thread is usually used to dispatch events.
@return true if this is the event dispatch thread -OR- is in headless mode.
methods.name: isEventDispatchThread
methods.comment:
Returns true if this is the event dispatch thread. Note that this method returns true in
 headless mode because any thread in headless mode can dispatch its own events. In swing
 environments, the swing thread is usually used to dispatch events.

return.comment: true if this is the event dispatch thread -OR- is in headless mode.

methods.javadoc:
A debugging utility that allows you to create a conditional breakpoint in Eclipse that will print items for you while it is performing its tests. This method always returns false. This means to use it you will have to OR (||) your conditional breakpoint expressions if you want them to pass. Otherwise, you can make this method be the only breakpoint expression and it will never stop on the breakpoint, but will still print your debug.

This method is useful to print values of code that you cannot edit while debugging.

Example, inside of your conditional breakpoint for a method on a Sun Java file you can put something like: printString("Value of first arg: " + arg0, System.err)

Note: Don't remove this method simply because no code is referencing it, as it is used by conditional breakpoints. @param string The string to print @param printStream The stream to print to (System.our or err) @return The string passed in so that you can use this method in an evaluation
methods.name: printString
methods.comment:
A debugging utility that allows you to create a conditional breakpoint in Eclipse that
 will print items for you while it is performing its tests.  This method always returns
 false.  This means to use it you will have to OR (||) your conditional breakpoint
 expressions if you want them to pass.  Otherwise, you can make this method be the
 only breakpoint expression and it will never stop on the breakpoint, but will still
 print your debug.
 
 This method is useful to print values of code that you cannot edit while debugging.
 
 Example, inside of your conditional breakpoint for a method on a Sun Java file you
 can put something like: printString("Value of first arg: " + arg0, System.err)
 
 Note: Don't remove this method simply because no code is referencing it, as it is used
 by conditional breakpoints.

params.name: printStream
params.comment: The stream to print to (System.our or err)

return.comment: The string passed in so that you can use this method in an evaluation

methods.name: getDefaultThreadPoolSize
methods.comment:
Returns the default size (in number of threads) for a CPU processing bound
 thread pool.

name: SystemUtilities
comment:
General purpose class to provide convenience methods for doing "System" type
 stuff, e.g., find resources, date/time, etc. All methods in this class are
 static.

fields.javadoc:
System property that signals to override the font settings for Java and
 Ghidra components.
fields.name: FONT_SIZE_OVERRIDE_PROPERTY_NAME
fields.comment:
System property that signals to override the font settings for Java and
 Ghidra components.

fields.javadoc:
The system property that can be checked during testing to determine if
 the system is running in test mode.
fields.name: TESTING_PROPERTY
fields.comment:
The system property that can be checked during testing to determine if
 the system is running in test mode.

fields.javadoc:
The system property that can be checked during testing to determine if
 the system is running in batch, automated test mode.
fields.name: TESTING_BATCH_PROPERTY
fields.comment:
The system property that can be checked during testing to determine if
 the system is running in batch, automated test mode.

fields.javadoc:
The system property that can be checked during runtime to determine if we
 are running with a GUI or headless.
fields.name: HEADLESS_PROPERTY
fields.comment:
The system property that can be checked during runtime to determine if we
 are running with a GUI or headless.

fields.javadoc:
The system property that can be checked during runtime to determine if we
 are running in single-jar mode.
fields.name: SINGLE_JAR_MODE_PROPERTY
fields.comment:
The system property that can be checked during runtime to determine if we
 are running in single-jar mode.

fields.javadoc:
isInTestingMode - lazy load value - must allow time for runtime property to be set
 by GenericTestCase
fields.name: isInTestingMode
fields.comment:
isInTestingMode - lazy load value - must allow time for runtime property to be set
 by GenericTestCase
